page.title: 04Conservation at Courteenhall
page.content: Sir Hereward Wake regards conservation as one of the most important aspects of estate management. As the major landowner in this area he is able to create the environs necessary for the survival and preservation of local wildlife. Twenty small woods covering more than 100 acres, with approx. 250,000 trees have been created containing a mixture of deciduous and coniferous trees. The motorway (M1) which bisects this area has been lined with a band of woodland, including conifers which absorb some of the noise pollution. High hedges have been replanted. Small areas not suitable for cultivation are left wild in order that foodstuff for birds can flourish. A stream has been dammed to create a small pond environment to encourage associated wildlife, in particular, wildfowl.
